title: PHPstrcspn()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPstrcspn()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Print the number of characters found in "Hello world!" before the character 
"w":
<?php
echo strcspn("Hello world!","w");
?>

Definition and Usage
The strcspn() function returns the number of characters (including whitespaces) found in a string 
before any part of the specified characters are found.
Tip:
Use the
strspn()
function to the number of characters found in the string that contains only 
characters from a specified character list.
Note:
This function is binary-safe.
Syntax
strcspn(
string,char,start,length
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. Specifies the string to search
char
Required. Specifies the characters to search for
start
Optional. Specifies where in string to start
length
Optional. Specifies the length of the string (how much of the string to search)
Technical Details
Return Value:
Returns the number of characters found in a string before any part of the specified characters are found
PHP Version:
4+
Changelog:
The
start
and
length
parameters were added in PHP 4.3
More Examples
Example
Using all parameters to print the number of characters found in "Hello 
world!" before the character "w":
<?php
echo strcspn("Hello world!","w",0,6); // The start position is 0 and the length of the search string is 6.
?>

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
echo strcspn("Hello world!","w",0,6); // The start position is 0 and the length of the search string is 6.
?>

quiz.question:
What is found in a string 
before any part of the specified characters?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of found in a string 
before any part of the specified characters is 'found'.

quiz.question: What is This function?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of This function is 'binary-safe'.

summary: This tutorial covers PHPstrcspn()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPstrcspn()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPstrcspn()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
